meanings.definition: Having a darker shade than other objects.
meanings.sent1: The night sky looked even blacker after the storm passed.
meanings.sent2: The blacker cat stood out among the white ones.
meanings.sent3: The blacker clouds seemed to be playing hide and seek with the sun.
meanings.sent4: His mood grew blacker as the day went on.
meanings.sent5: The blacker paint made the room feel smaller and cozier.

meanings.definition: To make or become dark or darker in color.
meanings.sent1: She used a special dye to blacker her hair for the costume party.
meanings.sent2: The storm clouds began to blacker the sky as the wind picked up.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seemed to blacker the rabbit out of thin air.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident blacker the mood of the room.
meanings.sent5: The shadows of the trees blacker the path ahead, making it hard to see.

meanings.sent1: The actor was cast as the blacker character in the historical drama.
meanings.sent2: She admired the blacker models in the fashion show for their confidence.
meanings.sent3: The blacker of the two friends always had the best stories to tell.
meanings.sent4: In the painting, the artist captured the essence of the blacker figure beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The blacker in the photograph had a radiant smile that lit up the room.
